message.content: Expanding both equations gives $x^2 + xy = 27$ and $xy + y^2 = 54$.  Adding these two equations gives \[x^2 + 2xy + y^2 = 81.\]Since $x(x + y) = 27$, we have $x^2 + xy = 27$, so \[x^2 + xy + y^2 = 27 + y^2 = 81.\]Hence, $y^2 = 54$, so $y = \pm 3 \sqrt{6}$.  Since $y > 0$, $y = 3 \sqrt{6}$.  Then $x^2 + xy = 27$, so $x^2 = 27 - xy = 27 - 3 \sqrt{6} \cdot 3 \sqrt{6} = 9$, so $x = \pm 3$.  Since $x > 0$, $x = 3$.  Hence, $(x + y)^2 = (3 + 3 \sqrt{6})^2 = \boxed{54 + 18 \sqrt{6}}$.
